review: We went for birthday lunches and were not sure what to expect after reading reviews of this and other locations.  The food was good, just what we expected from other Red Robin locations. I had a gluten free bun for mine which is drier than regular bread. It costs a little more, but is easier to eat than with a lettuce wrap. Our server, Chelsea, was attentive and checked on us at regular intervals. The manager, Angel, came through as well to check on things. He saw my boys had demolished the fries and personally went to get refills for them.  Overall, we had a good experience with little wait time to be seated for a late lunch.

The food was great, the service however was unacceptable. I went here with my boyfriend for a date and we had to ask for silverware, which they brought. We also has to ask for napkins which didn't come the entire meal so we had to wipe our hands on our pants or lick our fingers off. Then while we were seat the tables next to us left and while the busser got the plates and drinks off, he didn't clean the table off at all before the next group was brought to the table. I was just disappointed in the service overall.

Once again I have to say that this national chain is quite good! The burgers are delicious and come with fries or you can get a salad instead. I took two grandkids and the kids meals look decent and for a little more you can get an unlimited root beer float. The tavern burger is just $6.99 so not bad at all! The service was good though I can see where the place can get quite crowded. These places deserve recognition and just because they are national does not mean they are crummy. Inside is attractive though it can get noisy.  Just pick a good time and you'll be fine. The menu is large so much to choose from. I see no reason to bypass this place whatsoever! The food is good and it worth stopping in for a meal.

I have been waiting for my food for over an hour still nothing. No silver wear no food. This place is a dump I will post a picture of what I'm sitting next to. I would avoid this red robin at all cost drive to the next closest one.

I've loved Red Robin since the late 80's and they've stayed consistently great over the decades to remain a favorite spot for my kids, family, and friends. While their burgers are among the best anywhere, it's the endless friend (with ranch!) that really keep us coming back. Glad they haven't spoiled this feature and realize it's a valuable signature feature. Most locations also have very friendly and efficient wait staff (though I've had a few stinkers over the years, to be sure). In short: for kids (with their own huge menu) and adults alike, Red Robin never disappoints.

Had a fantastic experience here this evening, Brendan was our server and he and his manager were both great, he had our good remade because he was not satisfied with the freshness of our bun and had great attention to details of our order. All was made right above and beyond what was expected. Will definitely return! Thanks Brendan!

We used to come to this Red Robin all the time when I was younger.  It was fun, clean, the food was good...it was the place to go for weekend family dinners and seemed like everyone in town went there.  Went here for the first time in a few years last week and was really disappointed.  We got there at 4:45 on a Saturday and were told there was a 30 minute wait for 3 people.  When we were finally seated, there were tons of empty tables.  It seemed like the wait was due to short staffing, which shouldn't happen at dinner on a Saturday night.  My menu had food all over its pages and the floor in the area we were seated in was absolutely disgusting.  It looked like they hadn't swept in days.  We ordered a single order of mozz sticks, which the people we were with had done just a few months ago, but where told they don't do that anymore, you have to get a double order...seems like they could have easily made the single order and priced it anyway but just wouldn't take the time or effort to do so.  The food was fine, nothing outstanding and nowhere near as good as I remember it.  Luckily the service was pretty good.  I just feel like this restaurant has gone down the drain.  It used to be really really good and fun but I left this time feeling sad and kind of gross.

I happened upon this place for lunch while in the area. This place was really busy but there was only one waiter for the whole dining area so service was really slow. I ordered the Bonzai Burger which came with a grilled pineapple and a tangy sauce. The burger was an interesting flavor combination, the sweet of the pineapple mixed well with the tangy sauce and while I usually put ketchup on my burgers, this one did well with out it.

Every time we went has been a better experience. Dan was our server. He was observant, knowledgeable and attentive. Appears there's a bit of trouble within this restaurant, but there always employees that handle it better than others. Dan is one of the employees.  The person for the reason of my last review is a person that seems to be a bit of an a hole. (would love to say more) Kyle, bad service last time we had him and I can see he's not the best with his Co workers.

Everything was going good in the beginning. We had a large group, and they seated all of us in a timely matter, which was great. Our server Rosie was nice, but we waited for our beers for about 20 minutes which was a little frustrating, but we were patient because they were busy. Food was good, other than my hamburger was a little pink and I asked for Super well done. I go to pay, and she comes around to get which items were on my ticket. I told her which ones, there were about 5 orders, I asked if my discount was applied, and made sure she got them entered correctly, which she says yup I have it all here. Then my balance comes up which is all she showed me on the screen, I pay, she added in her gratuity tip, and she tells me please take this survey for me, which I did. And we were done. I had my receipt emailed to me, and after looking it over that night at home, I was charged for things I didn't order. Kinda upset me because I repeated to her my items and she said yes I got it. I should have looked it over myself before paying, but she was so quick to get her survey, and check us out, I assumed everything was correct since she said it was 2 times. I ended up paying almost $20.00 more than what I ordered. Either someone in my group had a less amount due, or she pocketed it. Not very happy, I work in the Marketplace and eat here a lot for lunch, but I think I'm good here for a while....

I love going to Red Robin at this location because the servers have always been nice and attentive. We always get our food fresh and hot. My parents always order the Banzai (I think that's what it's called) and I always order a regular cheeseburger. We have noticed that as soon as we get our food, we have to place an order of more fries because they give us no more than 10 the first time, but that way we get a second round of super hot fries. One time only we did get our burgers very cold (this might have been a couple years ago), but the manager at that time fixed it quickly, and we honestly haven't had any bad experiences here.   BTW, they have a Brazilian server, I totally forgot his name, but he's such a sweetheart... and very handsome, by the way! He's been awesome the couple times we got him. Anyway, we've had great experiences here and I hope that never changes!

Front host is a JOKE. We asked to throw trash away and she said, " no, someone didn't take out the trash I guess you can use the bathroom." She is a larger girl with excessive makeup. She was sitting on her butt when we walked in. She could have taken her trash it at any point.  We asked another hostess to move tables, I was holding a sleeping baby and they put us in chairs. We asked to move to a booth so I could lay him down, she said, "no im sitting someone here." She was pregnant, she needs an attitude check.  Andre the busser was FABULOUS. He cleaned a booth and sat us down. He needs a management position. Only person we had contact with who was friendly, kind and accommodating.  MANAGEMENT: Time to clean house.
Used to like this place but I just turned 21 a month ago and was denied a drink because my "ID was vertical". Bullshit, never coming back.

Sorry folks.  Downgrade on this place. Seriously NOT told about added charges and extras, even when I asked. First off my order was wrong. This is not the Whisky River (onion straws? Could I have a pickle?). I asked to have a few dipping sauces. "Is there a charge I asked"? "No" was the waiters response. So I ordered some garlic aioli and a smidge of cheese sauce to dip my fries in. Note the picture of the amount of cheese sauce. $1.19. Garlic Aioli .75 cents. Played the Ziosk game at the table. This one I assumed was free like at Chili's. It's not. $1.99 entertainment fee? Could you please put up a little notification sign?   Free Birthday burger, which was nice, but when I asked the waiter about the charges he was like "sorry". People, Bad Daddy's Burger Bar is coming to the same location soon. They are truly awesome and you can have all the condiments you wish for free AND a free birthday burger. I just don't appreciate the integrity style of this type of Management.  I'm scratching my head on this one.

This Red Robin is better than the rest! No matter where I sit the service is excellent. However if I see Dana behind the bar I always want her. She never rights anything down and she has never gotten my order wrong and not only that she just takes excellent care of every guest in her section, while making it look so easy. Even though I know it's not. This is a 20 minute drive but I will make it for this kind of consistently excellent service! Thanks Dana you're the best!!!

I am a Red Robin addict, I love their food. I also like that the food tastes the same no matter where we go. The only reason I gave 4 and not 5 stars is because this location brought our appetizers over literally 2 min before our food. We didn't really get to eat our apps at all.  The environment here was nice and clean. We were seated pretty quickly and the staff was very nice.

This is a bad Red Robin!  We went here for dinner last night and the hostess was really nice and upbeat, but everything sucked from there (except my Caesar wrap, that was okay).  We ordered the "voodoo" fries which are described as being "drenched in queso."  They took forever to come out and only had enough cheese to cover the top fries. I know I'm sounding like a fat kid, but come on.  They were also described as coming with a dipping sauce, which they didn't.  We couldn't find our server most of the time, and even when she was in our area she seemed to circle around all of her other tables and ignore ours.  Our entrees also took way too long to come out for a salad and a wrap. They also have little computers on the table which are supposedly supposed to make it easier to get drink refills and print your tab.  Ours didn't work.  Go figure.

We only came here because a seven year old made the call. She wanted chicken strips which they do offer.  I'm not a fan of big burger joints.  My husband made the smart choice and went for a traditional burger. That's what you do in a place like red robin. You don't do what I did which was try to upscale a red robin burger.  My choice was a burger on ciabatta topped with garlic aioli, roasted tomatoes and arugula tossed in olive oil. The olive oil was dumped on the arugula so much that I had a layer of oil on the bottom of my basket. Everything was soaked in oil. I literally could not eat it.  Our waitress was great and brought me a new bun, making sure I was happy. She was awesome. The burger was decent but I would stay with a classic when coming here because they just don't have the fancy angle nailed down.

Like others have mentioned here, the service is pretty disappointing.  1. They refuse to cut the burgers in half for you, and the wait staff say it's because the cooks don't want to. Uh, what? It sounds entitled but every other burger place gladly accommodate this request.  2. Drinks took 30+ minutes. Our party had people get the bottomless strawberry lemonade as well as root beer floats. They took forever to come. Servers seldom came by to refill so we had to be on high alert every time one was near. And my friend at first was told (after like 20 min) that the root beer float machine was broken or something and asked if he was ok with just a root beer. He said no just cancel it then, and then the waitress said "Okay, let me try the other machine and see if that works." Why didn't she do that in the first place? 3. Burgers also took forever after the drinks 4. When we paid, we opted to all lay separately using the tablet since it lets you split the check however many ways you want. A convenient option, except the waitress kept coming back and hovering over whoever was currently paying, which is awkward because she could totally see what you were tipping. And frankly we didn't want her to see because we were not happy with the service. So we just ended up always waiting for her to walk away before tipping. Basically, when we wanted refills on drinks or fries she is nowhere to be seen. And while we are paying she is back every minute.  Sorry Red Robin. Hope the service gets better.

Terrible, our server gave our tab to someone else,and they had paid our tab, so the manager came over and explained he had an estimated bill for us, not itemized, we didn't leave a tip, service was awful, when I got my bill on my Visa we were charged another 15.00 that we did not authorize, fighting it with my bank, it was pure fraud on the managers part.  I will never go to another Red Robin again, being from out of town it was a horrid experience.

boyfriend and I stopped here after a day of waterworld craving burgers and fries. red robins food has always been good and the service we received was great from Tom at the bar. Love the whiskey chicken wrap!

Substandard location. Service was very slow even though it wasn't very busy. My husband had the chilli burger but it was luke warm. Mine was ok but fries and food took a long time. Staff was more focused in showing us their table tablets for us to get out bill and leave.

My third time coming to this chain, first one in Colorado. It seems that the prices have been more relax. Very competitive to the competition Fridays, TGI, Outback, and the sort.  My free dbl tavern burger was very puny but delicious. The steak fries were good.  Very busy busy location. Expect long waits on your food and obnoxious crowds.  I probably won't be back for a great while.  Maybe I'll try their happy hours if they have any. $3.50 draft beer specials everyday (coors light or bud light)

We came for my birthday lunch and I wasn't disappointed.  I ordered a Merry Moscato Punch, French Onion Soup with A1 Peppercorn burger.  My son ordered the Banzai burger and the Bottomless Root Beer Float.  The drink was delicious, the soup was delicious the burger was okay.  It was dry, but it's always dry when I ask them to cook the meat.  I always ask for extra sauce on the side. The onion bun was hard.  My son's sesame seed bun was soft.  Fries were hot and that's always a plus.  The waitress was nice, but not the most attentive.  We had to ask for refills.  She'd walk up and ask if everything was tasting good and we'd reply yes and she'd run away before we could ask for refills. I actually interrupted her when she ran away from us to talk to the table they just sat 2 tables away.  We came at 11am right when they opened so it was basically empty and really no excuse for not having refills done promptly.   I'll go back again, probably not often though.  My son loves burgers, but we can find burgers closer to our home.  That's just my experience with one waitress.

Hubby and I are here working from Colorado Springs.  We always enjoy Red Robin and this visit was no different. We were greeted right away but decided to sit at the bar top.  Kyle was our bartender/server.  He took very good care of us.  Our order was correct, hot and yummy!

Slow Monday night...  Service was not up to par....  Yes we had an 11 top...  Server was very nice.  Drinks were a tad slow for a empty bar...  Food was tasty.  Slow to check back and even slower to bring out 2 orders of fries after everyone else was almost done. I think I'll stick to my normal location.

Burgers were great!  Great grilled taste.  The children's mac n cheese looked a little...clumpy, but they ate it.  Don't order the carrots with the kids meal.  They were very dried out and looked like the prepared kind you buy in a bag.  Ugh.  Service was marginal, at best.
Best service I've had at a fast casual restaurant in a really long time.  Had a late lunch in the bar area yesterday.  The food was excellent and the service was perfect.

I totally violated my grain and visited a chain.  I fully regret it.   The host could use some more refining in their skill of crowd-control.  They should always keep a look out for adults who would not mind sitting in the bar area.   The table was so greasy - I should had walked out, but hunger won.  The only cool thing about this establishment was the collage on the far wall by the bar of the US made of different beer signs by region.

Been to Red Robin in the past, but not for a long time now. Visited there recently to the Arvada location for the first time in a while. I'm giving 3 stars for the level of service, but no stars for the item I ordered. The service was good. Attentive, quick, and accurate. I ordered the black & bleu burger. I saw the price tag of $14.00 but figured what the heck. I was really hungry and figured I would get a nice sized ordered.  However, when it was delivered I was shocked at how puny it was especially for that price. Pretty big let down in that respect.  It truly was ridiculously small for that price. Shame on you Red Robin.

I was at this Red Robin this past weekend and just wanted to mention what great service my family and I received from Ryan in the dining room. Although he checked in with us maybe one too many times, it was nice that he was very attentive. We were also impressed with his friendly demeanor and how promptly he responded to our various needs. Needless to say, we will be back! Thank you Ryan!

Don't do a To-go  order it will be wrong 85% of the time. Not even a sorry or a glass of water while i wait for them to remake a medium well burger which still came out overly well done second time around. Can i get a lil pink, who r the cook there 12 yr old kids.

We are leaving as I write this. We got no service. Not bad service, absolutely NO SERVICE. No joke. We were seated in the bar area and sat for 10 minutes with no acknowledgement from anyone. No drink order, no "I'll be right with you", nothing. Probably some of the worst service EVER. We won't be going back.

We went here for lunch the other day as we had coupons and there was one in our area. We have been to Red Robin a few times and the service has always been awful at the ones we have gone to. Not so with this one! Ashleigh was our server and she came over to take our order pretty much as soon as we decided what we wanted, which was coincidental, but also pretty swanky. My husband got a Burger which he gulped with much joy. The burgers come with bottomless fries, but of course you're going to be given six at a time. Seriously. :/ Thankfully, Ashleigh was on top of it and never complained about fetching another six for him. I got a salad with dressing on the side and grilled chicken and it was good. Both our lunches came out quick and were really fresh.  Red Robin still isn't our first choice for lunch or dinner but the service was so good at this one that we will probably go back again if we wind up in the area.

We decided to come here after an afternoon of kayaking.  The waitress, so far, is lacking in skill. My youngest ordered milk. The waitress brought strawberry lemonade. I ordered a root beer float. I received a mug of foam with a small swirl of ice cream. She is either the only waitress in the entire packed restaurant, or she needs to find a new career.  Food was cold when it was served.  We had to ask for drinks multiple times before getting them.
This place is always busy! Seating is fast, we are always served quickly and the burgers are great! Can't beat the unlimited fries! My choice for burgers and fries

Never again people NEVER AGAIN! Now before you jump to conclusions about how I am an impossible to please, one star giving monster, feel free to check my record. This is the first one star Yelp review I have ever given. I love giving out 5 star ratings but this place deserves to be my first one star review! So my BFF and I decide we are going to go out for a girls night on the cheap and decide Red Robin was a great idea for apps and drinks ( I personally have not been to one in over 3 years but my experiences always have been good before last night). We order the onion rings (which were fine) pretzel bites( the beer cheese sauce was probably a 3 out of 10 but still edible ) and the nachos. Who could believe someone could mess up nachos?? They bring out a burned mess of chili dumped on stale chips with a glob of sour cream on top. The first thing out of my friend's mouth is "where is the cheese?" We eventually found the cheese under the chips, crusted onto the plate. The kind of crusted on where you use a fork to pry it off and it has the consistency of the burned edge of a grilled cheese sandwich. This could have been overlooked if the chili was not absolutely disgusting. It obviously was the powdered kind that you have to add water and warm up and was not done properly because the middle of the chili chunks was still dehydrated powdered meat and beans! All this would have made for a less than desirable experience but the straw that broke the camels back was the behavior of one of their buss boys. We had been seated in one of those 2 seaters where one side shares a long bench with two other tables and the other side has individual chairs. Anyway we were sandwiched between two other 2 person parties who finished and left around the same time. The buss boy came to clean up the tables and set the dirty dishes bin full of glasses and dirty plates right  on the bench directly next to my friend and started loudly tossing half full glasses and dirty plates into it. Then he proceeded to do the same thing  with the table on the other side of us. He finished and while he was leaving he bumped her shoulder with the bin full of sloshing drink glasses  and dirty dishes  and did not say anything! I understand you have to clean up tables but do you really need to put your dirty bin on the same seat as one of your customers and then when you accidentally bump them with a nasty tub you don't say anything??  Between the gross food and insanely bad service I personally will never be back. So sad to have to give out my first one star review but Red Robin- you deserve it!

Good burger spot. The service is always good and the menu is diverse and easy to understand. The decor is awesome and always clean. I wish they had a bit bigger beer selection, nothing like a good beer with your burger. I will be back soon I'm sure. Great place to take my child as well.

I usually like Red Robin and the food at this place isn't too bad but the service is just horrible. The last time I was there was the straw that broke the camels back.  The hostess was so rude she grabbed a menu then walked away without saying anything then said "Come on" when neither my wife or I followed. We both just looked at each other then turned around and walked out. My wife was particularly annoyed as she worked as a server for years in college.  So we probably won't be back for awhile the only reason I gave this place two stars was the food is usually good when we do get seated.

We took my son here for his birthday! The server and the food were awesome! They brought a sundae out for my two year old and sang to him. He loved it! They were very patient and accommodating to our large group with three active young kids! As always the burgers are delicious and the fries were never-ending!

Worst. Service. Ever. While the staff was friendly, it was difficult to get their attention. The bottomless fries were only refilled twice and spent most of the meal empty and waiting. Add to that the awkwardness of the waitress hovering over our shoulder while paying and calculating tip. Definitely not returning. At least the food was normal like any other Red Robin.

I love Red Robin in Arvada. I ordered the regular cheese burger. I forgot to tell them not to put mayo and the other sauce, which was totally on me so it came with more condiments than I like. They have good customer service and mostly don't have to wait too long for my water glass to be filled.  They do however take a while to get fries to the table. I love that they have bottomless fries but I feel like they should be checked almost like the water.

45 minuets later still don't have any food, my friend got a raw egg on his burger and mine had a stale bun on it and tasted like something from the burger king next door which is where I'm going next time it won't cost $8 I have never had a worse dining experience anywhere the server actually came to the table once during the 45 minutes between our appetizers and our food there were 5 of us and she refilled 1 persons drink it wasnt even busy in there

I know we're all supposed to be all superior and talk down on chains, but sometimes, I put on my hat, dark glasses, and Groucho Glasses and Moustache, and visit one. This time, what brought me in was an advertisement for their holiday Gingerbread Milkshake.  Holy YUM. And I actually like their burgers, (if they are a bit pricey at $10ish) and they cook their Medium to perfectly pink doneness.  It's a basic burger, but it's done right, and the service at this location has impressed me on more than one occasion.  They'll even give you a drink to go for the road (Non-alcoholic of course.) Of their non-burger selections, I've always enjoyed their Fish and Chips, and their Chicken Caprese sandwich was pretty darn amazing. Also:  Bottomless Steak Fries?  Yes, Please!!

You know what you are getting when you come into this place.   No surprises, and you should expect a menu with lots of burgers...   I love to come here, and love their burgers... messy ones, big ones, small ones, whatever, I have tried plenty.  I think my favorite one has the egg on it and I also love anything with bacon.   The bottomless fries are a great idea, I wish they would explore more ways to make them memorable... but I know their focus is on the burgers... and for that, I will not harp too much on French fries :)   What can you say?  Yummmmm!!!!

Both times I've been here, I had the fish and chips. On our most recent visit, there were very few fries included with my meal. The fish comes in 4 battered pieces, and it's decent. I found I needed to use all my and my husband's lemons, and add salt. My son enjoyed his pepperoni pizza and ate most of it. The mountain mud pie was okay, although it could have thawed a little before service, as it was rock hard.  The service on our last visit was terrible. She took a long time to greet us (besides saying "just a minute"). We gave her our drink orders, along with our appetizer order, and told her to come back for the dinner order, since we hadn't decided on that part yet. It took a lot longer for our kids' drinks to come out. I realize that chocolate milk comes from the bar, but it shouldn't take more than 5 minutes for them to be ready after we receive ours.  We were two chips into our artichoke dip, which took a long time to come out, when they brought our dinner out. Then when we were about halfway through dinner, she asked if we wanted 'to-go' boxes and/or dessert and didn't take note of our empty glasses, which we set at the end of the table. Before taking our dessert orders, she brought out balloons, which was a nice gesture, but we would have preferred for those at the end of our meal. We ate our dessert, during which she refilled our drinks and dropped off the check, standing up. She checked again and put our check holder flat on the table "since we weren't ready to go." I took the kids to wash their hands while my husband paid the bill. She still hadn't come by to pick it up by the time we came back from the restroom.  We felt rushed our whole meal and we didn't enjoy it as much. It was not worth the $60 we paid for it. We will not be coming out of our way to eat dinner here, and we'll consider other places first before we come here again.

This is not my normal kind of place but I must say having this for the first time it's  not half bad :) Service was fast and the place was clean :) We ordered the blue cheese salad wedge for $3 and two of us ate it.  I had the chicken sandwich for $9.99 it came put nice and crispy and the topping tasted fresh.  My sweet man had the blue ribbon burger which is a  blue cheese burger and loved it. It has those yummy fried onion strips on it. You can also order clam strips as a appetizer even though it is not listed on the menu. The one thing I don't like about places like this is the menu is to big and it takes forever to look over. But I feel we ordered some of the best they have to offer.  They also do a customer card so after you buy 9 the 10th is free. This reminds me more of a great hang out for teenagers :)

I've never been a fan of this place. Never liked the burgers but I thought I'd give it another chance and I'm still not a fan of the burgers here.  I asked for a plain cheese burger but it still had a few little pieces of lettuce. Its like they put it on and than tried to remove it but didn't get them all off.  Jason and Connie were great bartenders though and kept the drinks full and made sure everything was good. Great service and a good atmosphere. Probably won't be back just because I won't want to eat.

Will NEVER eat here again.  Gave me and my neighbor food poisoning.  I was upset to throw up a burger that nearly cost me $12.00 (regular cheese burger, nothing fancy).  GO SOMEWHERE ELSE TO EAT A GOOD BURGER THAT IS NOT OVERPRICED!!!!!!!!

Went here because my boyfriend's daughter chose it for her birthday. I didn't have high hopes but thought at least she's eat for free because red robin gives out free burgers on your birthday. Turns out this location doesn't participate in that program, lame. We ordered in a fairly timely fashion but waited a horribly long time for our burgers, 50 minutes. I suspect our server forgot to put our order in. When we got our food 2 of the 4 burgers were dry, and burnt. Sent them back. New burgers came out slightly juicier, but still not flavorful. The buns were so dry they weren't even worth eating, tasted like saltines. Seriously not impressed, that's my last visit to this burger chain. Tons of better options for burgers.

Food cold. Service poor. Dirty dining area.   Don't   come here! Waste of time and money. Burger King next door would have been cleaner, and better tasting.  I'm not sure how they have managed to stay open over the years. The last time I came here the service was awful too.

So I'm now updating a review that I left for Red Robins, cheeseburger and fries that I had yesterday were awesome real fresh and tasted wonderful the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because my mom ordered a hamburger and after a few bites she notice that I was still raw inside the burger so she returned it but my burger was excellent and the fries are excellent and I will definitely be back as a customer.

Banal. The service was good once we were seated after a million hours. The burger was overcooked and straight to the table from a box in the freezer. The one alcoholic beverage I ordered to chase away the mundanity of it all lacked any alcohol whatsoever and tasted like kool-aid.  But it's a Red Robin. You kind of know what you're getting when you get there. And apparently things like fries are bottomless, if you want to eat them. Which I pretty much didn't.

While I still come here twice a year - for my free birthday burger and my husband's too - we have found ourselves here more often than that in the last year or so. What now floats my boat is their tavern double burger. In spite of having two patties (not my normal pick), it's smaller than all of the other burgers on the menu. It's also cheaper at just $6.99 (and about half the calories and fat grams too, if you dare to look at their nutritional info). But during football season, when the Broncos get two sacks, their tavern double is free with another purchase on the Tuesday after the game! That burger reminds me of a Smashburger with muuuch thinner patties, a smaller and softer egg type bun and even a "smash sauce" type of condiment. I seriously love it.  I also like their rotating seasonal tap because I've tried a bunch of brews there that I'd never have picked on my own, especially a variety of Sam Adams seasonals, most of which I've liked even though I hate their Boston lager. The servers and bartenders surprisingly know a lot about their beers. Side note: if they bring you a beer and you don't like it, they will bring you something different out right away. They also have Alaskan Amber on tap which is pretty dang hard to find in Colorado, and one of my favorite basic easy-drinking beers. Another side note: this is actually an alt bier, not an amber! Yum. Their draft, well, marg and wine prices are ridiculously cheap during their twice daily happy hour which we caught last night at 8:30pm. I had a glass of wine for $2.50! My husband's schooner of craft beer was $4. Football season is almost over but I still have my free bday burger coming up soon...woot.

Red Robin: A chain restaurant that specializes in overpriced hamburgers and "bottomless" this and that. Needed more flair for sure.  Despite calling ahead to make reservations for our party of 13, which were accepted over the phone, we were notified upon arrival that Red Robin does not take reservations. WTF? Fortunately, the wait was mostly bearable and nobody had to run next door to (shudder) Bennett's for some survival chow. My burger was plain and tasted fine except for the lack of anything resembling meat flavor. The "bottomless" fries were OK but were greatly improved by a generous dash of the "bottomless" imitation Lawry's seasoning salt and a few squirts of the "bottomless" house ketchup.  Those of us who wanted mustard had to share a single bottle that someone in our party had to go steal from the kitchen area. The tortilla soup was tepid, gelatinous, and as exciting as a trip to a gas station restroom. My "bottomless" root beer float was soft serve and root beer. Could any less effort be expended? The only thing good about the trip was the waiter. Except that he forgot to bring out the mustard.

I was hesitant to visit red robin, I used to work at another red robin location and knew if it was anything like the store I worked it wasn't going to be a good experience. First off, the atmosphere in there had everyone at my table feeling uncomfortable. I know having worked at red robin that when cooking a burger your customer should be fed within about 10 min. We waited about 20-30 min for our food, during our wait I discovered our silverware had a huge chunk of lettuce on it so got up and asked for a new one. The waitress grabbed a new knife looked at both sides and gave it to me only for me to realize it also had food on it. We got our food finally and to no surprise my burger was undercooked, fries were also undercooked and flimsy. I understand keeping up with everyone's bottomless fries at red robin is a challenge but that doesn't mean customers dinner should be ruined because of it. I will not be visiting red robin again unless some major changes are made.

Not much to say other than lousy service. They messed up are order which got my girlfriend very sick we had a very simple order she just has a food allergy. So then i ordered a desert paid my bill tipped waited about 20 minutes for the desert. The desert never came out and the waiter said i never paid for a desert. They refused to give me what i paid for even though my receipt said i got a desert.

Avoid like the plague, the poor service plague. I've been here twice since the complete redesign. First time took me off guard and the Royal burger I ordered just sucked and totally disappointed compared to what I had remembered and loved. But that's not the point of this review... So my most recent experience was what convinced me to never again visit this RR (maybe all RR). I came because I had a birthday reward on my Royalty Card and was hankering for a delicious burger. The place was practically dead and there were many many tables open but where were we sat? Next to a huge family table with crying babies! Geez thanks. Course they didn't start crying till after we placed our order and got our waitressed pissed at us, which brings me to my next point. I was informed that my birthday burger wouldn't actually be taken off the tab, but instead the cheapest burger would be removed. Wth, how is that worth it when I order a $12 burger and my guest orders a cheapo $6 regular? So I say I want separate tabs so I don't stick my friend with a high bill because of my overpriced burger and $4 lemonade. So then the waitress totally takes on a sour attitude and starts answering with single words and dirty looks, geez. So the babies start to cry, the chairs suck, the water tasted like shit because of the recent flooding and our waitress is avoiding us and acting like a total B. Which is why I didn't ask to move, whatever, just wanted to eat and leave. Didn't even care to speak to manager since I will for sure most definitely never go back. Fries were cold and limp, burger was pink when ordered med no pink, and by the time we were done and offered a sundae for my Bday I just couldn't wait to get out of there, so I politely declined, paid, tipped (we all have bad days so who knows what was really up with her) and vowed that was the last time. I don't recommend this place. The wait-staff seems extremely inexperienced and uncaring or fake, and there was no sign of a manager anyway. The atmosphere is far too pub/tavern/bar and the food was just too meh. At least my burger was free...?

Took 15 min to be addressed at the table. I asked for a prickly pear lemonade and was given the margarita version. Took over 40 min to get our food, and we never got our appetizer. I waited for her to come back because I needed mustard- needless to say we were done eating by the time she was ever near us again. At the fifteen min mark we stood up to leave and the waitress came over so we stayed, I'm sad we did. It wasn't overly busy there were many open takes. Several tables around us were complaining as well. Maybe is was an off night, but man. The service in the place has dropped off in recent years. Our waitress would have preferred to be anywhere else and wasn't afraid to hide it. The food tasted good, and someone stopped by to make sure it did. But the food wont bring me back. Save yourself the hassle and go somewhere else

I don't usually do to red robin. But tonight the family decided red robin it was for dinner.  I got their chicken tortilla soup which was super hot when it came to me(that's how I like it) and reallyyy yummy. I could have done with less beans tho. But it was still good.  I also tried my cousin's bleu cheese burger &it was soooo good! I definitely recommend their burgers. Hot &juicy.  The wait for the food wasn't too bad so that's always a good thing. Our waitress was so nice too, her name was Dustie.  I will be coming back here again. (=

We're regulars at this location for the last 2 years and have always had excellent service. We always sit at the bar. We came on a Thursday at 7:30pm and there were 4 people at the bar. After taking our first drink and food order, the Bartender(guy) never came back. We literally had to go to the section of the bar that had napkins and forks and reach over to get them for ourselves. We also had to go and get a box for our leftovers. He never came back. It would have been nice if he had checked on us to see if we needed anything.
Dirty dishes, good food but overpriced. Macaroni and cheese side was something out of the microwave.  Came here because Namiko's was closed on New Year's Day.

The quality of their meat is unacceptable. I'm no snob about fancy meats, but every bite of this burger patty was full of gristly, hard bits -- like they'd ground up parts other than the muscle to make it. It's like that Jamie Oliver TV show where he grinds up the whole chicken carcas -- bones and all -- to make a chicken nugget. That is what this burger patty reminded me of. After a few bites, I couldn't take it any more. I ate the bun and threw the patty away. Never again.

Wifey and I received a gift card for Christmas and ventured into this place last Saturday night at 6:00PM for dinner. The wait was about 10 minutes, and we were then escorted to a two person booth, where the seats were still wet with bar-rag sludge after being hastily wiped down. The overall cleanliness of the place was disgusting. Food particles on the utensils and plates, food on the window, and friend crumbs all over the floor. We were met with a tablet on the table which was also filthy, and therefore we didn't even touch it. I sent my silverware and plates back to be washed again. We ordered the wings, which were actually pretty decent, but nothing to rave about, as they were served without ranch or blue cheese as we requested. We ordered two burgers, one with chili-cheese fries and one with onion rings, and both of the sides were inedible. The Onion Rings were soaked in grease, and the chili-cheese fries looked like they had been sitting out in the window for an hour. The chili was cold to the touch. We picked at our burgers which were "OK" but again, nothing to write home about, and we flagged our server down to pay. When prompted to use the tablet for this, I left the gift card on the table with some cash for tip and left. You couldn't pay me enough money to touch that disgusting tablet. Will avoid this place in the future for sure.

When nothing but a beer and burger will do...come here. This is a family place and they give balloons to the little ones. Fun picture booth in the lobby area. They are always busy but the service is excellent and the younger staff is very high energy and friendly. They have a large menu but we always get the burgers, fries, onion rings with cowboy sauce and a ice cold blue moon on tap. The fires are the thick old school steak fries and the burgers are always cooked well and sloppy good!!FYI ... The kids can order any gourmet burger from the menu in a kids size.... Just found that out today.

Red Robbin has a wide selection of burgers (chicken or beef) often accompanied with fried onions inside. If you're not a fan of burgers then there are options of salads, wraps or even soups. Although I like the idea of bottomless fries with almost every meal that a customer orders, I could not have more than the one serving provided with my burger.   The menu was packed with lots of other options, sometimes making it difficult to choose. The downside to Red Robin is the price. I believe that every burger on that menu was around $10.00, which is quite costly!  My particular meal wasn't exactly great.  The final bill was $28.00 (tax+tip) for two chicken burgers accompanied with bottomless fries.
Gluten free buns & lettuce wrap options! Yes! Always loved them but the fact they went this extra step for us 'special' people is great! Thanks!

Today marks an all time low for Red Robin.  Tablets on the table when we were seated and my six year grand daughter proceeded to play on it.   When we proceeded to pay on the tablet we had a $1.99 charge for her use of it.  We then got to process our own credit card over all experience makes me feel like I should not return to this chain.
Went in and boy was it a mistake. Usually don't have a problem but our waitress is on vacation!!!! Rrrgh.

Now the food was AWESOME as it always is. But, every time I go the service gets worse...and worse. The first time I had noticed was a few months ago. We had waited about 30 minutes AFTER we were done eating to receive our check. Then another long wait for our waitress to take it. We had to put the big guy on-top the little book at the edge of the table for her to finally pick it up. They were not busy at all so we don't know what the hold up was. A Monday at 8. Then just a few weeks ago we came back. That was because I just turned 21 and wanted to experience my first public legal drink. Well the waitress we had was rude. I had asked a simple question (Just moved to Colorado). I asked her even though I am 21 and my ID says im a minor, Colorado state License, but my birthday states that it was my birthday a few days prior of coming to the restaurant, if I could still drink or do I need to wait to get a new id. She was looking around the room and said "no you have to have an id" I told her I had an ID telling you I am 21, but I don't have a new new one yet. Well then she avoided the question, said, "like a glass of water? great I will be right back for you all." and left. None of us WANTING glass of water. Well I shrugged it off, fine whatever. Well she came back IN A HURRY to leave once again. We told her we were ready to order our food and drinks. Well it came my turn to order and I wanted their fruit smoothie. She gave me a smart remark, "You know there is no alcohol in there right?" I could NOT believe she even said that. I told her I knew that's why I HAD to order it. She rolled her eyes! I was furious at that point. I wanted to talk to the manager, but I didn't feel like making a scene. I was actually going to let it go at that point. Well, we received our food, ate for a minute, and she brings us our check. Like really? Are you not going to ask if we would like it separate or dessert (Which my sister-in-law and I wanted after we ate). Well my husband wanted more fries. We tried catching her and she completely ignored us. Well lets just say we didn't get our dessert and she got a very low tip. That completely ruined my night. Where I am from there is NO Red-Robin. Every time I came to visit, Red Robin was the one restaurant I wanted to visit. I moved here and service sucks. Food is still great though!

The food is pretty good for the price and we rarely have service issues.  Typically the manager stops by at least once to ensure the staff is meeting expectations and is eager to listen when they fall short of this expectations.

No where as good as the flat irons location.  I ordered a bun less burger and they acted like they never heard of it.  We go to this location every year for my daughter and mother in laws birthday.  I wish it was under new management.

Oh its not the same Red Robin anymore. I loved this place as a kid for two reasons: arcade games and macho nachos. Red robin matured with my generation and still delivers great burgers. Ok selection of beers and is still kid friendly but not as attractive as a family spot.  Managed well! Ken really took care of us when a timing issue arose last time. They admitted the mistake, apologized and overcompensated on the bill!  Thanks for being human! A lot of places could learn from this.

Years ago when I used to nanny, I'd frequent Red Robin with the kids. They enjoyed it, and the food was decent. I also signed up for the birthday club back then and have received free birthday burgers ever since. The only time I go to Red Robin now is when I received my free birthday burger. It was tasty, but the bacon was limp. Bacon on a burger should be crispy. I was also bummed my server didn't bring my free birthday sundae. But it's embarrassing to ask for one's free sundae so I just let it go. My meal would have been about $13 if I had purchased both the burger and soda I consumed. I really don't think it's worth it, the burger is OK, nothing to write home about and I'm a little weirded out that they cook them on a conveyor belt.  Wendy's Baconator meal is $10 and I actually think tastier and a better value. But hey, when it's *free* I can't complain.

Very  sick all night. My wife ordered the veggie burger came out slimy and microwaved cold inside, sent it back. Asked for it to be cooked on grill or something. Came back again: Description; a steamy warm slab of off white slimy microwaved garbage puck, cold inside . I ate my fish and cold chips. Trying to eat slow so my wife could have her dinner with me. Turns out she was lucky not to have eaten anything. (We just asked it to be taken back and wanted to get out alive) I on the other hand ate most of my fish and about four cold hard french fries, hoping to salvage our dinner, waiting for the second try at cooking a veggie burger. Big mistake! I was sick all night long. (The ugly sick)... Do not eat here. Vegetarians Beware! Veggie burger looked like it was cooked in the dish washers sink. Bad. Bad. Bad.

The visit started off well, but things took a quick spiral.  We received a cold burger, and she forgot our fries!  In a series of strange events, she brought our fries, then quickly took them back once we discovered the cold burger, I had also asked for a side of broccoli, and only got about three pieces of it.  It was also cold and unseasoned.  The only saving grace of this horrible experience was Danael, I hope I'm spelling her name correctly, the bartender.  She tried to soothe our nerves by comping our drinks and making sure our order was finally correct.  I would not suggest going here.  This is not the first time we've received terrible food and poor service.

Hadn't been to Red Robin for ages.  Walked in the door, foyer was full. Several empty tables in the bar. Sat down and found out that we couldn't sit there with our high school age kids. BTW, that's not Colorado liquor law.  Thanks for trying to be my moral compass. Won't be back. Burger and service at the Braun Tap house was delicious, and we sat in the bar with our kids, no wait. Should change. The jingle to "Red Robin, dumb".

Delicious burgers, but the 5 stars comes from tech ambiance. This place is the first I've seen in person that has a digital touch screen kiosk at every table, allowing you to order food, call the waitress/waiter, and pay your bill! Awesome stuff

Oh man.... I was sorely disappointed with the burger here.  Burgerworks has a wayyyyy better burger than this place and I seriously thought it would be the other way around. When they ask you if you want "some pink" or "no pink", I didn't think my "some pink" would come "entirely rare".  It was barely browned on the outside and as thick as two sheet of plain paper together.  BORING....... The bottomless fries on the other hand were great and we had refills on those.  Yum! Margaritas for $5 in the bar during happy hour were good.  They have draft on special too for $3.50.  Service was quick and courteous, but I think I will have my burger at Burgerworks from now forward.

Wanted a burger, a beer and to watch a game. Tried to take the kids here tonight, our 17 and 18 year old kids,  and we're told " no kids in the bar area".  So we could wait 30 minutes to sit in the dining room with no sports and a bunch of little kids or go elsewhere. We chose the latter. Never again red robin... I can agree with no little kids, like under 12 but come on!
Finally someone got the message. Service great fries hot and great service. Dud not appreciate the surprise 1.99 entertainment fee for playing the trivia game.

I used to like red robins i brought my family in today 10-18-2015 red robin boasts bottomless  frys it should read bottomless frys but you need to  beg for them with our meal my burger  came with 10 frys  i counted them and every time i asked for more i had to ask twice (they were not even that busy) and when i did get more frys 15 frys per order when he would drop of frys i would look at basket and order more i get more frys at bottom of the bag at McDonald's  the server was very impersonal  he puts a screen down on table and tells me to order desert  or pay with this  i will never go back to red robins again i would give a negative  5 stars but this review  app is making my give a star rating
Our service was great.  It was lunch time and they were busy, but we were seated immediately. Food was brought out quickly. My burger was good, though I'd really expect more meat for a $10+ price.

Food was okay. It wasn't as good as some other Red Robin's that I've been to. Service was awful. We asked for a basket of fries and she literally brought us 5 fries. There were 5 of us eating, and I know the fries are a pretty good size, but 5 fries was not enough. We had to work hard to get anything done for us, and when the check came, we had to wait about 20 minutes before she came back around so that we could ask for her to split it.  She finally came to split it, but walked away quickly before asking who was with who.  She ended up bringing us 5 separate checks. My 6 year old son got a check.  It was ridiculous. I'm not sure If I would go back to this location.

Our hostess and server were very nice and friendly even though it was busy.  We went for my son's birthday because we had heard it was great for kids and it was.   The kids can choose an entree and bottomless side dish. They had several healthy options which was nice.  Mine chose fruit salad which looked very good...not like canned fruit cocktail.  They had a birthday sundae for my son and we ordered another for his buddy.  The staff came and sang a quick song for him which was perfect.  A balloon artist walked through and with my approval made them a balloon shape of their choice.  He does work for soley on tips so bring a little cash in case he is there. I don't know if he is always there or not.  Of course, you don't have to get a shaped balloon.  It's just a fun option.  They were also given a Red Robin balloon which added to the birthday fun.  The kids left with smiles on their faces, full bellies and their arms full of balloons.  It was just want we needed!

Red Robin has gone down hill! They used to give you a basket of fries right when you sat down. Nope not any more, I had to ask and they were dried out , one was ice cold and I spit it out. My son got a grill cheese and the cheese wasn't melted. My girlfriend order a burger and it tasted just like a Whopper from Burger King. I ordered the cod and it was soggy.  Stay far away from this Red Robin it stinks!

Great value for sure. Tasty burgers and great bottomless fries make for a great combo. I've been to many RRs and this one is as consistent as the others. I'm not a lover of chain restys, but this one always pleases and seems worth the money every time.

How do people eat this garbage? I just spent 3 weeks getting over the stomach flu, leave it to Red Robin to put me back on the toilet again! After I ate their "delicious gourmet" smoke and pepper burger, I immediately acquired gastric/kidney/pancreas/appendix pain, followed by non stop farts. NO THANKS! I'll never eat at one of these par for the course chain restaurants again. I do however highly recommend Red Robin for those looking to get on the morbid obesity/diabetes/high cholesterol/death fast track.

I'm surprised by the poor reviews of Red Robin. I've been going here for years and years, and it's one of very few restaurants that I can go to and know that I'll have a great meal every time. I've never had a bad meal here.  Sure, the burgers are overpriced (at our last visit, around $10 for a basic cheeseburger!). But they're cooked right and they're delicious- juicy and flavorful (and messy).  And who doesn't like a burger served in a diaper? I also like the bottomless steak fries, and the service is always good.

Horrible service......sat at the bar for ten minutes without being greeted, the bartenders avoided eye contact. Never asked for a second drink, sat there with food in front of us or about ten minutes without any ketchup, or silverware. All in all a terrible experience. I won't be going back

I am giving Arvada Red Robin high marks for our experience last night. 95% of you have eaten there and know what you are getting - casual family atmosphere accompanied by tasty american fare. My generous four star rating is for the amazing staff at the Arvada Red Robin.    Last night, we were quickly greeted and seated next to a very loud and foul-mouthed group of three adults accompanied by a sleeping infant. For those of you who don't know me, my careers have consisted of notoriously cuss-filled situations fueled by caffeine and high stress. I, too, am known to drop an f-bomb or too, when I really mean it. These people, however, were disgusting even to me. Their constant shouting and relentless use of the f-word (completely lacking creativity I might add. Just: adjective this and adjective that) compelled me to ask to be moved to a different table.  We were moved immediately. Several staff members helped us move our food and we were seated out of earshot of this rude crew. The manager came over and apologized profusely and said they talked to the offenders. They felt truly sorry and did everything they could in this situation.  I'm grateful and I'm giving a chain restaurant four stars for it.  Not to mention their fries are crack-cocaine addictive. Yum!

You know, I really hate giving this place only 3 stars because 9 times out of 10 we have a nice visit. That was not the case for two nights ago. We went in around 8pm and sat in the bar. Our waitress, Mona, had (at most) 4 tables and a few singles in at the bar. We waited 45 mins for our food, asked for refills and never got them and she hardly came to the table. We even had someone else run our food for us and they were DEAD. I believe it's one thing when you are absolutely slammed and you become slightly distracted from checking on all of your tables, but when you are taking care of roughly 10 people and you are "too busy" to quickly stop by to check on how things are going and grab refills I get a little annoyed. So yes, this reflected on her tip, again it's a shame because we normally have a nice time and this waitress threw us for a curve ball. Hopefully the next time we come in our experience is a bit better and more.... attentive?

well  now im a believer yelp really does work the thing is you have to use it i just came from red robin what a disappointment we have not been there for a wile i dont know what happened but this place sucks i took the family and spent 65.00 for mediocre food how can you screw up a burger well leave to a gourmet burger place i guess my biggest complaint  was the service from the not so welcoming hostess to the un attentive server i cant stand bad service when im paying top dollar and when i told the manager he could not care less well thats ok  because thats it for me... and yes i will take the time to write a revue so thet it might help one person DONT GO THERE     GO NEXT DOOR TO BURGER KING  really its that bad  .       boooo

I came here for homecoming with a group of ten people and a reservation, but we all still had to wait twenty minutes to get seated at the bar. Seating ten teenagers at the bar in seperate tables and areas should have been our first indication of how bad the service was going to be all night.  We all had bottomless drinks, but we spent much more time waiting and asking for refills than actually getting drinks. Getting any sort of attention from a passing waiter was a battle in itself. Personally, i had a waiter walk by and ignore me twice. Between the ten of us, we probably asked for a re order of steak fries at least five times, but no one ever got a single order. Although all of our orders were taken at the same time, by different waiters too, the food came out seperately. Two people get their food; wait ten minutes; four more people get their food; wait twenty minutes; two people get their food; wait five minutes;  the last two people got their food after over half the table was finished eating. I was the last person to get my burger after everone, so I was always watching the clock.  After watching all my friends eat their food, I was even more disappointed to find that the waiter had mixed up my order. I got my friend's date's rare burger, and he got my over well burger. We asked the waiter to swap out our orders,  and he said "Ya no prob", and he didn't come back until twenty minutes later when he came with the check. Exhausted by our attempts, we sucked it up and ate our cold and unappetizing food, minus the steak fries we continually asked for. However, it was okay because we didnt get to finish our meals because most of our group was ready to leave by the time we were halfway done anyways.  I understand that it gets hectic on a saturday night, but service should never be this awful, especially after you just spent all afternoon prettying yourself up for senior homecoming. I've been to this Red Robin a few times in the past and had okay service, mind you, it has never been on the "great" side of the spectrum. It was unfortunate that i was the one who recommended going here for dinner, and I ended up with the shittiest dining experience of my life. If you are going out to dinner in Old Towne Arvada on a weekend night, definitely opt out of Red Robin and try one of the more intimate restaurants along Grandview. If you like the chain restaurant and family atmosphere, try Texas Roadhouse instead.
I love this location! It was my kid's birthday and the manager, I think his name was Rich made him feel really special. Thanks, Red Robin. See you soon!

Do not come here if you can help it.  We came in the middle of the day 3pm for late lunch and we had to wait 15 minutes. Then we got to the back there were tons of empty tables.  Our food took forever to come and they are just kids chicken fingers and turkey burger and fries.  I will not come back here!

My family and I have been going to this Red Robin at least once a week for several years. I'm not sure if they recently got a new Manager or what, but lately it has been AWFUL. One of our favorite things about RR is getting the bottomless fries while you wait for the rest of your party and look over the menu. A couple of months ago they started making us order BEFORE we got any fries. That was bothersome, but the last time we went in was the final straw. Now they are actually CHARGING $1.99 for the "free" fries. That's like a mexican restaurant charging for the chips & salsa. It might sound like a small deal, but combined with the terrible service we've had lately and the new look, which I don't care for, I think we'll be visiting another restaurant for our weekly get-together now.

I genuinely enjoy their food.  The burgers are always good, the steak fries are spot on (though the price for bottomless fries is built into the higher than average burger price).  The service is always friendly.   My only issue is the speed of service.  We have been there 4 times in 2 1/2 months and it always seems to take forever.   An hour and a half for a burger and fries is a bit much.  I really don't know if I will go much more if it takes that long.  I can get a 5 course meal in a fine dining restaurant in the amount of time it takes me to get a single plate here.

I've been here 4 times in past 2 months. The food is good for this type of restaurant. The service is sooo slow.  The staff always seems either under trained or stretched too thin. either way, the service usually isn't as great as other Red Robins I've been to. the burgers are good. you can get free refills on kid's mac and cheese ... but no one will tell you this.
Mediocre experience.  Not terrible, but not worth returning.  Interesting tid bit - the location was renovated and is a test location for updating Rod Robin.

Since the remodel of the building and inside they have passed those cost onto the customer. I like the fact that I get a plate instead of the baskets but today's trip was disappointing guacamole bacon burger is now 10.29 and I felt like saying "where's the beef". There was hardly any guacamole and I actually finished the burger and I had a salad. So either I was super hunger or the burger is now smaller with a higher price. I will give them another chance but maybe I will try one that has not been remodeled.
Royal Red Robin burger is the best.  Nice beer selection.

Red Robin is just OK.  Mainly, when I sit at home and consider Red Robin an immediate image comes to mind of screaming kids, balloons, and arcade games.  I mean, it's great when I have my nieces and nephew with me - they love the place.  But when it's just me and a friend, I really have to be in the mood.   The food is just mediocre.  I wouldn't say there's anything especially extraordinary about the menu.  They do have some great burgers (and lots of them!) but you could find the burgers elsewhere, maybe not all under one roof but elsewhere nonetheless.  The salads are average, and I used to think the soup was awesome - until our server told us she had to "thaw it" before she brought some out to us.  Ick.  I guess I always just assume that soups are made in-house, yes corporate places have to follow a strict recipe, but really?  Red Robin you outed your secret of frozen soup, and I'm a bit grossed out!  Then there are the shakes!  I'm always game for a good shake, but it's a disappointment that they offer mint shakes but it's not mint ice cream!  It's vanilla ice cream with mint syrup.  I'm not too thrilled with that idea.  I appreciate the refill tin, though.   All in all I guess the place is acceptable - but nothing to get excited about.  This location has always provided great service, so that's where their third star comes from.  Otherwise this chain would be a two star!

My friends and I went here for the first time yesterday. I had a premium margarita and a Mai tai, they were ok..l but the thing that was gross was that there was a FLY baked into the food my friend got. The manager took care of our whole bill, but it was still REALLY gross...

You've most likely already been to a Red Robin at some point in your life. Or at the very least, you've heard those annoying "Yuummmmmmmmmmm" commercials they've had running for the past few years. Red Robin is like an Applebee's for burgers. Often scoffed at, but they've gotta be doing something right to have so many restaurants open, right? I've been to Red Robin a few times and have always gotten the famous Royal Red Robin burger (with a fried egg on top). This time I opted for the Guacamole Bacon burger, which comes dressed with guacamole, bacon, swiss cheese, tomatoes, onion, and mayo. With bottomless steak fries it checks out at $9.99. They also ask if you want it "pink or no pink" in the middle, which I kind of like as a cop out for them. Besides the dirty undertones, that question leaves them a lot of wiggle room. There's no attempt on their part to cook it EXACTLY how you order it, which we all know rarely happens. And yes, you have to get a little pink in the middle. Here's the crazy part: You know how major restaurant chains take ridiculous pictures of their food for advertisements, and it looks NOTHING like that in real life (See Red Robin pic in the gallery below)? Well, this time, it pretty much looks like advertised. Cut this burger in half, and it stands up big and tall just like the pics. And oh by the way, it tastes as good as it looks. The patty is indeed pink in the middle, with slight points taken away because the ends were too well-done and tough/chewy.

Very disappointing service.  I ordered a burger for myself and a double burger for my son. We both wanted our burgers well done. We waited and got our meals within 10-15 min.  I cut my burger in half and one half was very pink. I had to wait a little while before the waitress came by to see if we were enjoying our meals. I showed her how pink the half of my burger was and she asked me if wanted it cooked more. "Yes, I'm sorry, I can't eat this." Meanwhile, my son ate his meal and no one came by for 15 min, by then my son was done with his burger and he asked for more fries. The manager brought my meal, apologized and we asked again for more fries for my son. I indicated that my son is already finished with his burger so "can I get my meal to go?"  Cory brought my meal in a to-go box. Still no fries for my son. Then the waitress asked if we needed anything and at this point I'd had it.  I asked to speak with the manager...waited about 5 minutes. Cory came back and asked, "what can I do for you?" I replied, "What can you do?" He offered to give me dessert. Wait. 45 minutes of waiting and he wants to give me dessert? "No, I don't want dessert. I really just want to go and I don't want to have to pay for my meal. He said ok and walked away. We waited for the receipt so I could pay, for about 5 min and the manager walked by. I asked him if I can have a receipt and he advised I could use the tablet at the table. I didn't know how to use the thing so he pushed a couple buttons and said my meal had been taken off the order and walked off. I then noticed a $1.99 (Entertainment Fee)!? I pressed the button to ask for the server and waited...The manager walked by and I told him "there's an entertainment fee,I'd had enough entertainment for one night and I don't want to pay this." He said he'll get my server. Waited about 5 min and the server looked upset. I asked for a receipt and she asked if I wanted to see it before I gave her my credit card. "Yes please." She left and came back shortly, I reviewed it and gave my card. I informed the manager I would never return. He didn't seem to care,he just walked off. I wrote on the receipt that the manager needed better customer service skills. I want to kick myself that I  left a tip but the waitress was basically stuck in the middle of the cook's mistake and poor management. Based on this experience, wasted time, and poor management training. I well NEVER return to any Red Robin.
Nice, new red robin. But the downfall was extremely slow service. They do accomodate for gluten free, though, which is appreciated.

This is a place I've tried sporadically over the years, and always found good but not outstanding. Yesterday I found myself in the area and, since I was in the mood for a burger (which I usually am), decided to try it again. I had the peppercorn burger and found it... okay. The best thing about it was the little onion strings liberally scattered atop the patty (I love those things!), but other than that it was a pretty routine sandwich. I think the standard for a good burger is rising these days, what with places like Smashburger, Five Guys, and Larkburger appearing all over the Denver landscape, so maybe Red Robin needs to step things up a bit with a little fresher ingredients and higher quality beef (not that there's anything inferior about either now, they just didn't really rise above the competition). I'd say the steak fries are also fairly standard, but the fact that they're an all-you-can-eat proposition makes them an excellent value (but I swear I only had one modest refill besides my original order!). My Blue Moon Ale was tasty, especially after a morning outside in windy weather, which really made me thirsty. The waitstaff was also very polite and reasonably prompt, and seemed to be holding up well under the onslaught of families with little kids that stormed the place while I was there (eat here before noon on a weekend if you like quiet dining!). Overall it was a pleasant experience. Next time I'm in the neighborhood and hungry, I'm sure I'll go back again. There are some interesting chicken and fish items on the menu, so if I can overcome my seemingly unlimited addiction to cheeseburgers, maybe I'll find something to get a little more excited about for my re-review.

Thought I'd give it a try again.... They still don't get it. Asked for no relish, burger came loaded with it. Asked for two pattys, only one on the burger.... I've given this location enough chances. Never again. They just can't get it right. 5 out of last 6 times they've got the order wrong. Service is sub-par as well. Next time I'll make the drive to another location. This one has lost me forever.

NEVER AGAIN!!! I come here from time to time for a blue ribbon burger, this time we didn't even get our drinks in the first 15 minutes. Then when I we got our fries they were all soggy, Then came the burger which I usually love. But this time it had way to much sauce and no blue cheese along with soggy discolored lettuce and tomato that were probably sitting under a light for the last 10 minutes. The manager came over to ask how my burger was and I told him about the problem. I was absolutely baffled at what happened next....he told me that I should have ordered it with less sauce, like it was my fault. The audacity of this lazy, plastic smiled, prick. Everyone in there obviously follows his lead because no one gives a Shit. Even the hostesses didn't even greet us or said good bye, they were to busy gossiping and doing nothing. I would strongly suggest going somewhere else for your burger needs.

The food isn't anything too special really.  They've got a really big selection.  One thing I do enjoy here is their milk shakes.  There always seems to be alot of kids and noise though.  Its a fun atmosphere but not a great date place.

If I could give zero (0) stars I would! This place has the worst service and food. Fries are sooooo bland!!! Burgers are absolutely disgusting! People who don't know good food come go this place! The bartender wouldn't even take my order for the first 15 minutes. Every one else in the group got their order taken. She apparently had issues that night. But for suburbia food, it's still crap!
We eat here once a week, so maybe thats why they're so nice to us, also the rewards card actually saves money we often get whole meals taken off the tab, never any complaints, keep the good work up!

Sung like the commercial: "Dead Robin!  ...Y-U-U-U-CK!" My favorite place for burgers in Denver is a little place on the northwest edge of town.  The burger is always cooked exactly the way I want it, favoring the rare side, but with nice caramelization on the outside.  Fresh tomato, onion, etc...  They make fantastic steaks too.  There's only one table, but the meal is always free to guests.  Only catch, you have to be invited because this is my house. I'm a little baffled about going out for a "gourmet" burger, but on occasion I can be cajoled into trying a new place.  I'll go along if that's what the gang wants to do.  But I avoid this place. What is there to recommend?  A zoo-like atmosphere with a thousand screaming kids (and I like kids!), a ho-hum burger (They all are, unless you go to the place I mentioned above.), and fries over-salted in a desperate attempt to get you to run up a bar bill.  They have thought of lots of different ways to serve a burger.  I guess I'd recommend reading the menu for ideas for next time you barbecue.  Oh yeah, I don't recall anything of the non-starch vegetable species on the menu, other than lettuce.  Green beans ROCK with a burger. Funny anecdote.  Years ago I went here with coworkers, one of whom was/still is in a wheelchair.  A car pulled into a handicapped spot about the same time we did, but we noticed the people wouldn't get out of the car while we were in sight.  We eventually surmised that they had a handicapped tag so their morbidly obese asses wouldn't have to walk all the way across the parking lot and they were embarrassed to get out of the car in front of someone who had real spinal damage. Anyway, I'm guessing this place is all about the kids (except for the bar, which is all about exhausted moms & dads).  But if you care about your children please challenge them by going somewhere on occasion where they have to behave and where they try something really good and interesting.
It's a chain and you get exactly what you should expect.  Typical food that's par for a Red Robin course.

Overall my experience was great. It was busy but we were sat quickly, Earl was prompt and got everything right, but as a server myself I don't agree with how things are done here. It took 20 minutes to get a fry refill because the kitchen was backed up and we were sat next to a larger party that had a woman seated at it that had a hard time getting out of her seat because our table was too close to theirs. When they got up so did the table next to them and the manager immediately came down to tell him they were putting two parties down at once. That is not a way to treat your employees or your guests. Sure, they got sat quicker but it results in the server rushing the dining experience and usually it's obvious that they are overwhelmed. That is not the ideal dining experience. I think they need to work on their seating techniques and the host staff in general. But other than that complaint our service was great and I would give Earl and the servers around him five stars for their friendliness.

Perhaps I'm getting crotchety as I sneak up on middle-age, but there are certain things I expect when I go to a restaurant.  I expect that there will be a spoon available to stir the sugar into my iced tea, and that I shouldn't have to ask for one. I expect that, when ordering a burger, mayo/ mustard/ ketchup should at least come on the side. You shouldn't have to hunt down your waitress, ask for the condiments, then have her look at you like you just honked her hooter. I also expect that, when you discuss your plans to make a movie time with the waitress, then ask for the check in the same conversation, she will actually bring you the check in a timely fashion. I could go into detail about the condition of the restrooms (pre-dinner-rush) at this point, but I think my job here is done. Suffice it to say, I won't be going back to this location any time soon.

There's a couple things that keep bringing me back to Red Robin. #1. I like their steak fries. #2. I am a fan of the Whiskey River BBQ Burger. That is some greasy goodness! The employees have always been friendly, but the actual service has never been great. I always get nervous when a) the waiter doesn't write the order down b) comes back to the table a few times to reaffirm the order c) the food still doesn't arrive to the table correctly. Yikes!  Like I mentioned, we'll more than likely come back to get our fix of fries and greasy burgers.

Just came in with a group of 18 people adults and children, our server Nick was outstanding great memory. Was able to remember everyone and devided the checks accurately. Thank you my sons B-Day was a hit

Was my first time at this location and I was a bit disappointed. Our waiter barley came to ask us anything, we had to keep looking around to find her and when we did she would take a very long time to bring us what we had asked for. But as always the good was good.

I went here with my 5 year old daughter.we had went to the one in Westminster at first since it was the closest one to us but when we got there the place was a little but the greeter didn't even greet us.she just stared at us Without saying a word.
