Finally after after about 5 minutes i went up to her and ask how long of a wait was there she said about 20 minutes and then had the nerve to ask me if i wanted to be put on the waiting list after starring at me for 5 minutes. So I grabbed  my daughter and left but I was still in the mood for red robin I decided  to try this location and I am glad I had did the service here was excellent. From the greeter who greeted us right away to the wait staff who went out of their way to make our visit a good one.from bringing my daughter another balloon without me even asking for another one after my daughter had accidentally pop the first one to bringing our food out in a reasonable amount of time and prepared the way we had order.and refilling our drinks and fries,without me having to ask or beg for more  like other places i been too.Oh and the food was pretty good too but the service is what makes this red robin special to me

Went to Red Robin yesterday with my Wife and Daughter and we have not been there in a while.  When we sat down we were looking over the new menu and it looked like some really good changes were made.  Our server came over to get our drink order and came back promptly for our food order.  I ordered the fish and chips and my Wife and Daughter were going to share a Royal Red Robin burger. Both of these dishes come with bottomless fries. Like we do EVERY time we go there my wife ask from some fries to start with and some ranch. We waited and waited and no fries came. I asked the waiter he then told me it was a new rule that they can not bring any out before the meal and he said he thought it was a stupid rule and he would bring some out.  Well, our meals came and we never got fries to start with.  I asked to speak with a manager because the waiter should have given me the option to order fries as an appetizer or maybe even have my fries first and no fries with my meal or at the very least to tell me about the rule after I asked when placing my order not right before my food came,  The Manger came over and crouched by the table and started giving me a story about why the do not allow fries first and stated it was because people will ask for fries first then order a bunch of salads.  I told him that it would have been good of him to come out and ask why I wanted to speak with him instead of assume and go off on a rant about their rules even though we had ordered our food already before asking for fries so his explanation didn't really mean squat to me at that point.  This is not the first time we have had issues with this Red Robin as a matter of fact last time the situation was much worse and that is why we had stopped going there for so long.  I guess it's time not stop going there again. I understand rules and I have no problem following them but customer service is about giving options and I did not get any.

So we are still really new in town, and our first night here we had to go out to eat. We chose here since it was close to home and thought our daughter would like it. My husband got a tap beer, which seemed kinda high priced (he got a colorado beer, and paid more here for it than we did living in nc), so I just got a water.  I had the california avacado chicken sandwich..it was good, but I have def had better. my husband got a wrap...not quite sure what he thought of it. Our daughter loved her meal...what 2 year old doesn't like mac and cheese though. All in all our meal was ok...I'm sure we'll go back, but it's not gonna be our "place"

I've been a Red Robin fan since I first tried it in Seattle seven years ago. I haven't tried more than a few burgers, but you just can't beat the Royal Red Robin Burger (with the fried egg in it) and other burgers like the whiskey burger and chicken sandwiches. Also, the atmosphere is great for large groups and kids, a fun place to hang out. A bit pricey, but worth it for the special occasion.
Our server was great, food was good as well, but I really hate when they auction food off at the table. Know where it's going before you bring it!!!!!!

I'm taking it down a notch because my daughter and I went there a couple weeks ago for a late lunch.  The service was not good.  The waiter took a good 15 minutes to acknowledge we were there and it wasn't even crowded.  The food was good as usual, but the waiter was not friendly, didn't check up on us and just made me feel like we were inconveniencing him.  I had to ask for silverware which should have been on the table to begin with.  This was the only negative experience I've had there so I will be back.  I just hope that waiter isn't there anymore.

Every restaurant has an off night. Things happen. But my most recent visit to this particular Red Robin left me very disappointed. For the first time in a very long time I ended up sending my food back to the kitchen because it was cold. And the steak fries had to be sent back as they tasted more like ice fries than steak fries. The greasy, soggy, but now semi-warm second batch of steak fries was sitting in a pool of grease 1/4 inch deep and that's where they stayed. I ate two of them off the top and spit them back out. The two others with me voiced similar complaints about their orders. Our server was great, but the manager who brought our second orders out to us didn't adjust the bill. I ended up paying the equivalent of $20 per person for soggy and cold food and iced tea that rated barely above the taste of Lipton Instant Tea. The only thing keeping this from being a 1 star review is our server hustled. But I seriously doubt I'll ever go back.
cool place, yummy burgers, good shakes, awesomeeeeeee fries. that seasoning is boss.

Red Robin is good eats, and though I don't go as often as I used to, I still enjoy eating there, and I love the steak fries, and I love the teyaki burger.  As to the previous review, it is a family restaurant, so I know it is going to be loud and full of kids before I go.  If I don't want that, I go somewhere else.  If you want to tone it down a bit, go up to the bar area, not as many kids in the seated area up there.  A great palce to go with the family and get filled with good food.

I'm not a big fan of giant burgers that require jaw bone separation to enjoy, but if that is your thing, then Red Robin is alright. That being said, I'm also not into being packed into an overcrowded restaurant and surrounded by screaming families while getting to hear Red Robin's "clever" take on the birthday song at least twice during every visit.

Woah, what happend to this place!  I haven't eaten at a Red Robin in a couple years as we've moved out of the Denver area, but when we did live here we loved Red Robin.  We popped in the other day and were very disappointed.  This location has remodeled and we don't like it at all.  It now has a very stark somber feel to it where before it was an energetic fun place to visit.  They are clearly changing their model and I don't think it's for the better. The burger wasn't very good, I think they have made them smaller and the meat isn't as high quality as it was.  The first fries our server brought us were stone cold and we didn't get fresh ones until we had finished our burgers.  The service was poor and slow, which went well with the new atmosphere created by their remodel.  Even the uniforms are bland now; they used to wear bright, chearful colors, now everyone is in black.  Not sure what Red Robin is going for but I won't ever go back to this Red Robin. If the other locations are going this same direction we'll be done all together.  Our over-all experence wasn't by any means the worst dinning we'ver ever had it just wasn't Red Robin.
